Detailed Description

Pathname wrapper.

BPath - A pathname wrapper class that manages conversion to and from various means of expressing pathnames, as well as any necessary resource allocation and deallocation.

See also:
MIT License
Author(s):
Tyler Dauwalder , Be Inc.
Version:
0

Definition at line 180 of file Path.cpp.

status_t BPath::Append ( const char * path,
bool normalize = false )
 

Appends the given (relative) path to the end of the current path. This call fails if the path is absolute or the object to which you're appending is uninitialized.

Definition at line 129 of file Path.cpp.

status_t BPath::Unflatten ( type_code c,
const void * buf,
ssize_t size ) [virtual]

Definition at line 184 of file Path.cpp.

void BPath::Unset ( )
 

Returns the object to an uninitialized state. The object frees any resources it allocated and marks itself as uninitialized.
